Row.Text: Adaptation
{1_CityName} was founded in adverse terrain. As a result, your people have adapted to life within it.[NEWLINE]Your civilization gains the following abilities:[NEWLINE]
Able to build Farms on Tundra.
Farms on Tundra gain +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Units, disctricts, and improvements are immune to Blizzards.
Able to build Farms on Desert.
Farms on Desert gain +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Farms on Desert gain +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Units, disctricts, and improvements are immune to Dust Storms.
Citizens are able to work on Mountains.
Mountains gain +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Mountains gain +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Mountains gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food per adjacent Farm.
Units, disctricts, and improvements are immune to Volcanic Eruptions.

Free Inquiry Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score each time you trigger a [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka. +1 Era Score for constructing a building that provides Science as a base yield.

Pen, Brush, and Voice Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer and +2 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score each time you trigger an [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration. +1 Era Score for constructing a building with a Great Work Slot.
Monumentality Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score each time you construct a new specialty District.
Exodus of the Evangelists Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet points per turn. Gain +2 Era Score each time you convert a city to your founded Religion for the first time.

Hic Sunt Dracones Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral points per turn. Gain +3 Era Score each time you discover a new Continent or natural wonder. Gain +1 Era Score each time you kill a non-Barbarian naval unit in combat.
Reform the Coinage Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score each time you successfully complete a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route.
Heartbeat of Steam Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score for each Industrial or later building constructed.

To Arms! Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score each time you kill a non-Barbarian Corps in combat and +2 Era Score each time you kill a non-Barbarian Army in combat.
Wish You Were Here Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist and [ICON_GreatMusician] Musician points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score for each Artifact extracted.
Bodyguard of Lies Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+25% [ICON_Production] Production toward Spies. Gain +1 Era Score for each successful offensive Spy operation.

Sky and Stars Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer and [ICON_GreatScientist] Scientist points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score for each Aerodrome building constructed. Gain +1 Era Score each time a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person is earned or purchased.
Automaton Warfare Dedication Bonus:[NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points per turn. Gain +1 Era Score each time you kill a non-Barbarian unit with a Giant Death Robot.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending vs. melee class units.
Siege penalty
-7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. district defenses.
Strength vs. district defenses.
Allows chopping of Rainforest. Reveals [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron.[NEWLINE]Your units get +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Barbarians.
Grants flanking and support (defensive flanking) bonuses to all combat units, as well as +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Barbarians.

Set.Text: Starts a war without warning. [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing and razing cities significantly increased.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player that Denounced you or that you have Denounced at least 5 turns ago. Standard [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing and razing cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player that religiously converted one of your cities. Standard [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing and razing cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player that captured a city from one of your Friends or Allies. No [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for liberating any of those cities, but capturing other cities causes increased [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player that captured one of your cities. No [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing cities. Standard [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for razing cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player that attacked a city-state you are the Suzerain of. No [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for liberating that city-state, but capturing other cities causes increased [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player that is two technology eras behind you. Standard [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing and razing cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player that borders your empire. Standard [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing and razing cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Requires that you are in a Golden Age with the "To Arms!" Dedication. Declare war on any player immediately after Denouncing them, without needing to wait. No [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing cities. Reduced [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for razing cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player who has broken a promise to you within the past 30 turns. Standard [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing cities. Reduced [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for razing cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

Declare war on a player who is in a different Tier 3 government. Standard [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing and razing cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances you cause to a player, the bigger the Loyalty penalty in cities you capture from them.

To Arms! Golden Age:[NEWLINE] +15% [ICON_Production] Production towards military units. Also unlocks a special Casus Belli that can be used immediately after Denouncing the target, generates minimal [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for declaration and razing cities, and zero [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances for capturing cities.

Row.Text: +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science from each [ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] Great Work of Writing, [ICON_GreatWork_RELIC] Relic, and [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact.
Your Civilization gains +1% [ICON_Culture] Culture for each Great Person it has ever earned, up to a maximum of +30%.
International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Luxury resource at the destination.

Able to build[NEWLINE]Monasteries:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Science] Science for every 2 adjacent Districts[NEWLINE]+15 HP healing for your religious units.[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Colonialism: +1 more [ICON_HOUSING] Housing.

+1 [ICON_Science] Science for every 2 adjacent Districts[NEWLINE]+15 HP healing for your religious units.[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Colonialism: +1 more [ICON_HOUSING] Housing.

Your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in foreign cities each provide +1 [ICON_Production] Production to your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes when they pass through them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Trading Posts are constructed when a Trade Route ends, at the origin and destination.)
Your Campuses with a Library provide +2 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points each.

Able to build[NEWLINE]Bateys:[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture per adjacent Bonus Resource[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture per adjacent Entertainment Complex[NEWLINE]Can't be built on Hills, or next to each other.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exploration: Doubled adjacency bonus.[NEWLINE]Flight: [ICON_Culture] Culture converted into [Icon_Tourism] Tourism.

+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture per adjacent Bonus Resource[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture per adjacent Entertainment Complex[NEWLINE]Can't be built on Hills, or next to each other.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exploration: Doubled adjacency bonus.[NEWLINE]Flight: [ICON_Culture] Culture converted into [Icon_Tourism] Tourism.

Able to build[NEWLINE]Cahokia Mounds:[NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity (once per city)[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Natural History: +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity if city has 2 Mounds.[NEWLINE]Feudalism: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food per 2 adjacent Districts.[NEWLINE]Replaceable Parts: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food per adjacent District.

+3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity (once per city)[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Natural History: +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity if city has 2 Mounds.[NEWLINE]Feudalism: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food per 2 adjacent Districts.[NEWLINE]Replaceable Parts: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food per adjacent District.
+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith from each [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route.
Each Encampment building reduces the cost of purchasing Land combat units with [ICON_GOLD] Gold by 10%.
When you use a religious unit to convert a city for the first time earn 15 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science per [ICON_Citizen] Population of that city (on Standard Speed).

Able to build[NEWLINE]Alcázars:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.[NEWLINE]+ [ICON_SCIENCE] Science equal to 50% of the tile's Appeal[NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength to units.[NEWLINE]Units Fortify instantly on this tile.[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Flight: [ICON_Culture] Culture converted into [Icon_Tourism] Tourism.

+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.[NEWLINE]+ [ICON_SCIENCE] Science equal to 50% of the tile's Appeal[NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength to units.[NEWLINE]Units Fortify instantly on this tile.[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Flight: [ICON_Culture] Culture converted into [Icon_Tourism] Tourism.
All your Apostles start with a free Martyr Promotion. +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every specialty district in the origin city.

Able to build[NEWLINE]Colossal Heads:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if on a Charming tile[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Flight: [ICON_Faith] Faith and [ICON_Culture] Culture converted into [Icon_Tourism] Tourism.

+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if on a Charming tile[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Flight: [ICON_Faith] Faith and [ICON_Culture] Culture converted into [Icon_Tourism] Tourism.
+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Your Traders are immune to being plundered on water tiles.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production towards buildings in Industrial Zones, Entertainment Complexes, and Water Parks. Their regional effects reach 3 tiles farther.
+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities from each Commercial Hub.

Able to build[NEWLINE]Mahaviharas:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +1 [Icon_Housing] Housing[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith per adjacent Holy Site[NEWLINE]Gain a free random Technology when you build your first Mahavihara.[NEWLINE]Must be built on flat land.[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.

+2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +1 [Icon_Housing] Housing[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith per adjacent Holy Site[NEWLINE]Gain a free random Technology when you build your first Mahavihara.[NEWLINE]Must be built on flat land.[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.
Districts on or next to Coast or Lake tiles provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Gold] Gold.

Able to build[NEWLINE]Nazca Lines:[NEWLINE]Unworkable, but provide yields to adjacent tiles:[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to tiles with a resource[NEWLINE]+1 Appeal[NEWLINE]Must be built on flat Desert.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Civil Service: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food to Desert tiles.[NEWLINE]Mass Production: +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to flat tiles.

Unworkable, but provides yields to adjacent tiles:[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to tiles with a resource[NEWLINE]+1 Appeal[NEWLINE]Must be built on flat Desert.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Civil Service: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food to Desert tiles.[NEWLINE]Mass Production: +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to flat tiles.
+2 Loyalty in each city. +2 more Loyalty per Encampment building.

Able to build[NEWLINE]Moai:[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture per 2 adjacent Moai[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture if on or adjacent to Volcanic Soil[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if adjacent to Coast or a Lake[NEWLINE]Cannot be placed adjacent to Woods or Rainforest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Medieval Faires: Double adjacency from other Moai.[NEWLINE]Flight: [ICON_Culture] Culture converted into [Icon_Tourism] Tourism.

+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture per 2 adjacent Moai[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture if on or adjacent to Volcanic Soil[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if adjacent to Coast or a Lake[NEWLINE]Cannot be placed adjacent to Woods or Rainforest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Medieval Faires: Double adjacency from other Moai.[NEWLINE]Flight: [ICON_Culture] Culture converted into [Icon_Tourism] Tourism.

Able to build[NEWLINE]Trading Domes:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold per adjacent Luxury[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to each International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route originating in this city.[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.

+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold per adjacent Luxury[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to each International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route originating in this city.[NEWLINE]Can't be built next to each other.
Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when you build a Campus or Theater Square.
Your Apostles have +5 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from Yerevan.
Landsknecht Pikeman
Medieval anti-cavalry unit that costs 40% less than a Pikeman upfront, but three times more [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn to maintain. Can move after attacking.
Landsknecht Pike & Shot
Rennaisance anti-cavalry unit that costs 40% less than a Pike & Shot upfront, but three times more [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn to maintain. Can move after attacking.
Templar Knight
Expensive Heavy Cavalry unit that can only be purchased with Faith in a city with a Shrine. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if within 1 tile of a Religious unit.
Commando

Expensive Melee unit that cannot be purchased with [ICON_Gold] Gold. Requires a Military Academy to produce. Can paradrop into enemy territory (range 7 tiles). The range extends to 12 tiles while in an Aerodrome or Airstrip. Ignores enemy Zone of Control.
Hit and Run
Can move after attacking.
Divine Fervor
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if within 1 tile of a Religious unit.

Holy Sites, Theater Squares, and Industrial Zones receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent other districts.
International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Receive +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Capacity every time you enter a Golden Age.

City Centers gain +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_FOOD] for every adjacent Desert and Desert Hills tiles. Mines receive -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. May purchase Commercial Hub district buildings with [ICON_Faith] Faith. -20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production toward constructing buildings or training units.

A district unique to Mali specializing in finance and trade that replaces the Commercial Hub. Units, Buildings, and Districts are 10% cheaper to purchase with [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_FAITH] Faith in this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for each adjacent Holy Site. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus from a tile containing a River edge. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for every two adjacent district tiles.
While established in a city-state or any player's [ICON_Capital] Capital, gain +3 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.
Rainforest tiles yield +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, provide a +1 adjacency bonus for Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts, and grant +1 Appeal to adjacent tiles instead of reducing it.

Allows Farms to be built on Tundra (including Tundra Hills at Civil Engineering). In Snow and Tundra all Mines and Lumber Mills provide +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, Farms provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, Camps provide +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and strategic resource accumulation rate is +100%. Reduces the purchase cost of tiles in these terrain types by 50%.

+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from coastal Resources. Naval Melee units gain the ability to perform coastal raids. +25% yields from Pillaging and Costal Raids, which also grant additional [ICON_SCIENCE] Science or [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Improvements (except Farms). Gain the Viking Longship unique unit with Sailing.

Naval units can cross Ocean tiles at Sailing. Embarked units can do so at Shipbuilding. Embarking and Disembarking costs no [ICON_Movement] Movement Points. Naval Melee units can heal in neutral territory.

A building unique to Norway that replaces the Temple. Required to purchase Apostles and Inquisitors with [ICON_Faith] Faith. This Holy Site district gets an additional standard adjacency bonus from Woods and Rainforest, and grants +1 extra [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral point per turn.

Norwegian unique Medieval era melee unit. Can be purchased with [ICON_FAITH] Faith, and has extra [ICON_Movement] Movement if it starts its turn in enemy territory. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.

+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Receive a random tech boost after another player recruits a [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer, and a civic boost when another player recruits a [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist or [ICON_GreatMusician] Musician.

A district unique to Russia for religious activity. Replaces the Holy Site district and cheaper to build.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your city border grows by one tile each time a Great Person is expended in this city. The Lavra provides +1 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer point per turn and a [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Work of Writing slot with a Shrine, +1 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist point per turn with a Temple, and +1 [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician point per turn with a Worship building.

+50% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Light Cavalry units. Light Cavalry units cost 30% less to purchase, and can be purchased with [ICON_FAITH] Faith. All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from Bonus Resources on flat tiles. Non-Hill Tiles with Charming Appeal yield +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith.
Scythian unique Ranged Light Cavalry unit with 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement and a [ICON_Range] Range of 1.
Holy Sites adjacent to a River receive +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing, and trigger a Culture Bomb when built.

Cities with an Aqueduct receive +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from entertainment and +0.5 [ICON_FAITH] Faith for every [ICON_CITIZEN] population. Farms provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food if adjacent to an Aqueduct and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith if adjacent to a Holy Site.
+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food from the adjacent River.
Mines receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production for every adjacent Seowon district. Farms receive +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every adjacent Seowon district.

A district unique to Korea for scientific endeavors. Replaces the Campus district. -4 [ICON_Gold] Gold, but starts with +4 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science adjacency. Each adjacent district reduces its [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, but increases its [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE]Must be built on Hills.
{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from adjacent districts.

Light Cavalry units start with the Caparison Promotion. Heavy Cavalry start with Charge. +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Pastures. Improvements over [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horses provide +2 more Horses per turn.

Major adjacency bonus for Commercial Hubs and Industrial Zones if next to a river. Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing a Harbor. +50% [ICON_Production] Production toward the Dam district and Flood Barrier building.

All units receive +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for 10 turns after declaring a Protectorate War, War of Liberation, or War of Reconquest. Your cities get +10% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture while you are not at war with any other civilization.

May form Corps earlier, after unlocking the Mercenaries Civic, and Armies at Nationalism. Corps and Armies gain an additional +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength. Capturing a city will upgrade the conquering unit into a Corps or Army, if the necessary civics are unlocked.
+3 Loyalty in cities with a garrisoned unit, increasing to +5 if the garrisoned unit is a Corps or Army. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in each city at full Loyalty.

+50% [ICON_Production] Production for 5 turns after declaring a Protectorate War, War of Liberation, or War of Reconquest. Trade Routes to players you have an Alliance with yield +2 [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_FOOD] Food for both cities.

+3 [ICON_Housing] Housing in coastal cities. Pastures trigger a Culture Bomb. Yields from Campuses, Commercial Hubs, Holy Sites and Theater Squares are +1 in tiles with Charming Appeal. All districts receive +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture on Breathtaking tiles.
[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas provide only 25% of a Technology's cost, but grant +1 Era Score. During a Golden Age, your cities yield +0.3 [ICON_Science] Science per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen.

Units receive +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength or [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength for each Holy City converted to Byzantium's Religion (including Byzantium's Holy City). You cities with Holy Sites gain +3 Loyalty, +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point, and exert pressure as if they were Holy Cities.
Receive +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each Holy City converted to your Religion (Taxis)

Your civilization gains [ICON_CULTURE] Culture equal to 20% of the unit’s cost when a non civilian is trained. Melee and Anti-Cavalry units receive +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for every adjacent combat unit.

A district unique to Gaul that is cheaper and available earlier than the district it replaces, the Industrial Zone. The Oppidum district is defensible with a ranged attack. When the first Oppidum is constructed the Apprenticeship technology is unlocked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Production] Production if adjacent to a Strategic Resource or a Dam[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production if adjacent to a Quarry improvement.

Breathtaking tiles next to a Mountain, Natural Wonder, or Forest gain +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. They also gain +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science if there's an adjacent Wonder. Doubled in cities with a National Park. All tiles in a city with a National Park have +1 Appeal.

Shrines built on Hills yield +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. Cities yield +10% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if their City Center is built on Hills. After you unlock the Enlightenment, these bonuses are also applied to [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. Units receive +4 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength on Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Rock-Hewn Church, unique to Ethiopia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Mountain tile. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight from [ICON_FAITH] Faith. +1 Appeal. Can only be pillaged (never destroyed) by natural disasters. Can only be built on Hills or Volcanic Soil not adjacent to another Rock-Hewn Church.
While you are in a Golden Age, all your units gain +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement and captured cities gain +10% [ICON_Production] Production.

Gran Colombian Industrial era unique unit that replaces the Cavalry. Low maintenance cost. +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each adjacent Llanero. Recovers 30 Hit Points when in range of a Comandante General that activates its retire ability.
-50% War Weariness. Each [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General gains an extra charge. Gain the Hetairoi unique unit with Horseback Riding.
+5 Loyalty in each city with an Ancient or Classical Wonder. +15% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in cities that you own, but weren't founded by you.

Classical era support unit. Requires a Barracks or Stable to produce. Can construct Roads, Railroads, Forts, Airstrips, Missile Silos, and Mountain Tunnel improvements. One of their build charges can also be used to complete 20% of a Canal or Dam district.
Improves [ICON_Movement] Movement speed of any unit moving from one road tile to another.
Improves [ICON_Movement] Movement speed of any unit moving from one road tile to another.
Improves [ICON_Movement] Movement speed of any unit moving from one road tile to another.
Improves [ICON_Movement] Movement speed of any unit moving from one road tile to another.

Can be constructed by Builders and Military Engineers. Does not cost a charge, but does cost 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal. Greatly improves [ICON_Movement] Movement speed of any unit moving from one Railroad tile to another. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes traveling over Railroads can multiply the [ICON_Gold] Gold they get from districts at their destination.
All units get +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against city attacks.
Strength from Siege Tactics.

Settlers trained in this city do not consume a [ICON_Citizen] Population. New cities receive a free Builder. +1 extra Loyalty from Monuments.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.

+5% [ICON_Gold] Gold empire-wide per city-state you are the Suzerain of.[NEWLINE]+3 Influence points per turn toward earning city-state [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
Can use [ICON_Faith] Faith to purchase any building in Holy Sites, Commercial Hubs, and Harbors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
Provides 4 slots for any Great Work.[NEWLINE]May purchase Melee, Ranged, and Anti-Cavalry units with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
+15% [ICON_Science] Science in cities with a Campus or Government Plaza.[NEWLINE]Patronage of Great People costs 30% less [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to the city's garrison and your units defending within its territory. Establishes in 2 turns.
Military units trained in this city start with a free promotion. (Does not stack with other free promotions)
Defense Plans
City cannot be put under siege. Enemy Spies operate at 3 levels below normal in this city.
This city gains an additional [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strike per turn.
Orator
Cities that you own within 9 tiles gain +4 Loyalty per turn towards your civilization. (Including this one)
Propaganda
Other foreign cities within 9 tiles gain +4 Loyalty pressure towards your civilization.
While established in a city-state, provides a copy of its Luxury and Strategic resources to you. Gain double the amount of Strategic resources if you are the suzerain.
Foreign Relations
+2 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.

A spiritual and Religious leader, {LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_CARDINAL_NAME} can increase the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength of a city, as well as give it extra ways to spend [ICON_FAITH] Faith.
Your units get +10 [ICON_Religion] Religious Combat strength in this city's tiles, and it gains [ICON_CULTURE] Culture equal to its Holy Site's adjacency bonus.
Religious Services
This city lets you buy Builders with [ICON_Faith] Faith and ignores pressure and combat effects from Religions not founded by the Governor's player.
Laying on of Hands
+10% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in this city if it has a Holy Site, and your units in its tiles fully heal in 1 turn of taking no actions.
Resource Operations
This city gains +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Bonus and Strategic Resources, and +1 resource per turn from improved Strategic Resources.
Colonialist
+50% [ICON_Production] Production towards Settlers in this city.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_EDUCATOR_NAME} is focused on the cultivation of [ICON_SCIENCE] Scientific endeavors in the city. He is also quite skilled in the attraction of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People to his city.
15% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science generated by this city.
Sophist
The Campus in this city gets an extra +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science adjacency from other Districts.
Deacon
+2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science per specialty District in this city.
Academic Workshops
+30% [ICON_Production] Production towards city Projects that grant [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person Points.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production towards the Spaceport in this city.
Construction Corps
Builders trained in this city will get +1 more build charge. All Builders across your empire gain +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
Zoning Commissioner
+25% [ICON_Production] Production to Districts. This city can build 1 more District than its population allows.
Grand Architect
+15% [ICON_Production] Production towards Wonders in this city.
Shrewd and fiscally knowledgeable, {LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_MERCHANT_NAME} is able to strengthen the economic power of a city, or give fresh small cities a big starting boost.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each unimproved feature. Tiles adjacent to unimproved features receive +1 Appeal.
The city gains +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and acquires new tiles 20% faster.

Monuments, Granaries, and Water Wheels cost 50% less and yield +1 [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Food] Food per turn in this city.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route you send from this city.
Yields +2 Appeal and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity if adjacent to water. Each city can only have City Park.
Gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Barbarians on all your units, for the rest of the game.
Instantly creates a Fighter unit in the city. Grants 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum per Turn.
Grants 1 free technology from any era and a [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka towards Computers.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science from each Library. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each Market and Bank. Triggers the [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for Machinery and Printing.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture from Workshops.
Industrial Zones provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing, and Culture Bomb adjacent tiles upon completion.
+10% [ICON_Production] Production towards Information Era military units.
Breathtaking tiles in this city yield +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.

+1 [ICON_Food] Food from each Farm in your empire.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production towards Districts across your empire.
+15% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire.
Gain {Amount} [ICON_Science] Science.
Pastures over [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horses provide an Amenity. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold to Camps.
Allows for the creation of Nuclear Devices. Requires the Government Plaza.
Allows for the creation of Thermonuclear Devices. Requires the Government Plaza.
Requires the Government Plaza. Adds one Nuclear Device to your nation's inventory. Requires [ICON_Resource_Uranium] Uranium. Maintenance is 14 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Requires the Government Plaza. Adds a Thermonuclear Device to your nation's inventory. Requires [ICON_Resource_Uranium] Uranium. Maintenance is 16 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

Grants +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to adjacent unimproved Charming tiles. Increased to +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for adjacent unimproved Breathtaking tiles.

Grants +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to adjacent unimproved Charming tiles. Increased to +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith for adjacent unimproved Breathtaking tiles.

Shieldbearer bonus
+4 Strength from the Shieldbearer.
Sniper Team

Support unit that has a ranged attack that's effective against Melee, Ranged, and Anti-Cavalry units (+20 [ICON_Strength] Strength). Severely less effective against other units, but is able to Priority Target enemy Support units.
Sniping
+20 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee, Ranged, and Anti-Cavalry units.
+20 Strength against footman units.

Ignores movement penalties through Woods, Rainforest, and Hills. Pulls land units linked with it in an Escort Formation.
Citizen-soldiers

National College

Limited to 1 per civilization. Requires a Library. Enables the "Switch to Tall Science" project.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]After you complete the "Switch to Tall Science" project, this city will get Retinue Quarters (+4 [ICON_Housing] Housing, +10% Growth) and will yield +1.5 [ICON_Science] Science per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen, BUT your other cities that do not have Retinue Quarters will yield -50% [ICON_Science] Science.
Research Institute

Limited to 1 per civilization. Requires a National College. This district gains 1 extra Citizen slot, and its Citizen slots yield +1 [ICON_Science] Science. Consumes 2 [ICON_Power] Power. Enables the "Advance Tall Science" project.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]After you complete the "Advance Tall Science" project, this city will yield +50% [ICON_Science] Science, BUT your other cities that do not have Retinue Quarters will yield -25% [ICON_Science] Science.
Switch to Tall Science
Tall Science

Requires a National College. After you complete this project, the College city will receive Retinue Quarters (+4 [ICON_Housing] Housing, +10% Growth) if it does not already have them, and will yield more [ICON_Science] Science from its [ICON_Citizen] Population. BUT your other cities without Retinue Quarters will yield -50% [ICON_Science] Science.
Advance Tall Science
Advance Tall Science

Requires a Research Institute, and the "Switch to Tall Science" project to already be completed. After you complete this project, the College city will yield +50% [ICON_Science] Science, BUT your other cities without Retinue Quarters will yield -25% [ICON_Science] Science.

Limited to 1 per civilization. Requires a Ministry of Culture. This district gains 1 extra Citizen slot, and its Citizen slots yield +1 [ICON_Culture] Cutlure. Consumes 2 [ICON_Power] Power. +2 Diplomatic Victory Points and grants 2 Apostles when built.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built adjacent to a Holy Site district with a Temple, and you must have founded a Religion.
